intro: Premna pilosa, commonly known as the hairy beggar-tick, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Verbenaceae. It is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, giving it a fuzzy appearance. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pale green to yellowish in color. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Premna pilosa is sometimes used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
